Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to manage stress at work more effectively.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports feeling more relaxed and less stressed after engaging in activities like playing guitar and taking breaks during work.
Current Functional Status: The patient has been practicing relaxation techniques and has improved communication with their girlfriend, leading to a stronger relationship.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows progress in managing stress and improving communication skills.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice relaxation exercises, including deep breathing techniques.
Next Steps: The patient plans to incorporate relaxation exercises into their daily routine.
